comment: Easiest class offered at KSU but this woman makes it untolerable. She's boring, lectures have nothing to do with assignments or quizzes and 5 to 7 assignments due each week with excel assignments taking a few hours to complete. was an extremely tough grader Take someone else shes tenure she dont care

Decent professor, but be warned she is disorganized and gets VERY defensive when you come to her with concerns about an assignment, your grades etc. She's not tech savvy which resulted in careless mistakes such as entering “0's” for completed quizzes and “not knowing” how to access my FINAL EXAM score so she wanted me to “just retake it”.

She is a very nice woman but is very disorganized and gets super defensive is someone corrects her. Talks so much but never about anything on topic or important. Constantly gets sidetracked and forgets what is going on.

While she was kind, she was often disorganized, and I was regularly confused by assignment details. The group project is tedious, and unfortunately counts a lot towards the final grade. Lots of busy work and projects, and the two exams cover a ton of material from the textbooks. I wouldn't recommend taking this professor if you have other options.

This professor does not meet the criteria to be a teacher. She was out of class for two weeks for vacation and posted recordings of her reading her powerpoints from start to finish, as she does in class. On top of being out of class for multiple weeks, she even took attendance on who watched the videos while ironically being gone.

Take her! She was very caring and wants you to do well in her class. Although there is a lot of material and assignments to complete, she helps every step of the way. Go to her class because she offers extra credit if you do so. One midterm and one final. A quiz every week and she allows for 2 attempts. One group project.
